identificationModule.briefTitle: Home Monitoring for Atrial Fibrillation Using a Microlife Blood Pressure Monitor
identificationModule.officialTitle: Home Monitoring for Atrial Fibrillation Using a Microlife Blood Pressure Monitor: Trial of Regular vs Irregualr Pulse for the Prevention of Stroke (TRIPPS 2.0)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study assess the accuracy of a blood pressure monitor designed to detect atrial fibrillation. Subjects use the blood pressure monitor on a daily basis for 30 days and compare the readings to an ECG done at the same time.

interventions.name: Microlife blood pressure monitor with AF detection (Microlife AFIB MLU3MQ1)
interventions.description: Monitoring heart rhythm daily for 30 days using the blood pressure monitor and the ECG recorder.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of the blood pressure monitor used for detecting atrial fibrillation compared to the electrocardiogram.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After final subject data is available.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assess subjects understanding of the use of the device for atrial fibrillation.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After final subject data is available.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria: any of the following

* age 65 or older
* hypertension
* diabetes mellitus
* congestive heart failure
* previous stroke

Exclusion Criteria:

* permanent pacemaker
* impalantable defibrillator
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients seen in a general medical practice.
